name: The Wide World Of Sports Quiz | Wide World of Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: There are five countries that have participated in all the modern Olympics:   Greece, Britain, France, Switzerland and which other?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	Remember that the other two powerhouses, the USA, and Russia, both have boycotted.

questions.text: How many teams in the NFL have names of birds?
questions.explanation:
5.

	The five of them are, Arizona Cardinals, Philadelphia Eagles, Atlanta Falcons, Baltimore Ravens, and the Seattle Seahawks.

questions.text: In what year was the first 3-point made in the NBA?
questions.explanation:
1979.

	It was shot by Chris Ford of the Boston Celtics.

questions.text: Lacrosse was invented in which country?
questions.explanation:
USA.

	It was invented by the American Indians.

questions.text: The game of softball had a different name when it was invented by George Hancock.  What was it called at first?
questions.explanation:
indoor.

	It was played inside, thus giving it the name indoor.  It was invented November 30, 1887.  A broomstick was used as a bat, and a boxing glove was used as a ball.  Indoor was later changed to softball by Walter Hakanson.

questions.text: In 1987 who was the first goalie in the NHL to have scored a goal?
questions.explanation:
Ron Hextall.

	He scored against Boston. He scored again, as a goalie, in the play-offs against Washington Capitals in 1989. The first goalie to be credited with scoring a goal in the NHL was Billy Smith (New York Islanders) in 1979. A Colorado Rockies player had put the puck in his own net and Smith, as the last opposing team member to touch the puck, was credited with the goal.

questions.text: Dr. George F. Grant is the one who invented what?
questions.explanation:
golf tee.

	I would guess that most of you picked a cup being that he is a doctor.  You know what kinds of medical problems can happen when things happen down there.  He did come up with the tee because they used to have to make a clump of dirt to set your ball on.  He did not want to get his hands dirty.  He invented it on December 12, 1899.  Pat applied for was 638,920.  They did not use gloves then when they operated so they did it bare handed, but he did not want to get some dirt on his hands.  Isn't that funny?

questions.text: How many panels does a soccer ball have?
questions.explanation:
32.

	Just an odd fact that I thought you might find interesting.

questions.text: Who was the first person to run a mile in under four minutes?
questions.explanation:
Roger Bannister.

	He was from Great Britain.  On May 6th, 1954 he ran it in three minutes 59.4 seconds.
